Hill Climbing and Simulated Annealing Algorithm Implementation

Overview
This submission implements two optimization algorithms over binary strings:
(1) Hill-Climbing (100 random restarts) to maximize f(v)=|13·one(v)-170| where v is a 40-bit vector
(2) (2) Simulated Annealing (200 random restarts) to maximize f(v)=|14·one(v)-190| where v is a 50-bit vector

How to Run
1) Unzip the file
2) Run .\dist\main.exe, and the output will be printed to Output.tx
 
Output (Output.txt)
